lines.gurmukhi: jYsy joDw juD smY ssqR snwih swij loB moh qXwig bIr Kyq ibKY jwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Jodhaa Judh Samai Sasatr Sanaahi Saaji , Lobh Moh Tayaagi Beer Khayt Bikhai Jaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a brave warrior goes to the battlefield wearing his armour and his weapons, renouncing all his love and attachments.

lines.gurmukhi: sunq juJwaU Gor mor giq ibgswq pyKq suBt Gt AMg n smwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sounat Jujhaaoo Ghor Mor Gati Bigasaata , Paykhat Soubhat Ghat Ang N Samaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Listening to the inspiring music of battle songs he blooms like flower and feels happy and proud seeing the army spread like dark clouds in the sky.

lines.gurmukhi: krq sMgRwm s√çwm kwm lwig jUJ mrY kY qau rn jIq bIqI khq ju gwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Karat Sangraam Svaam Kaam Laagi Joojh Marai , Kai Tau Ran Jeet Beetee Kahat Ju Gaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Serving his master the king, he is performing his duties and is killed or else if alive, returns to narrate all the happenings of the battlefield.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy hI Bgq mq Bytq jgq piq moin AO sbd gd gd muskwq hY ]617]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Hee Bhagat Mat Bhaytat Jagat Pati , Moni Au Sabad Gad Gad Mousakaat Hai ?617?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, a traveller of the path of devotion and worship becomes consciously one with the master of the world. He either becomes totally silent or singing His praises and paeans, remains in a state of ecstasy.  (617)
